   19: %%
   20: -module(beam_lib_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %%-define(debug, true).
   23: 
   24: -ifdef(debug).
   25: -define(format(S, A), io:format(S, A)).
   26: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   27: -define(config(X,Y), "./log_dir/").
   28: -define(privdir, "beam_lib_SUITE_priv").
   29: -else.
   30: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   31: -define(format(S, A), ok).
   32: -define(privdir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Conf)).
   33: -endif.
   34: 
   35: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   36: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   37: 	 normal/1, error/1, cmp/1, cmp_literals/1, strip/1, strip_add_chunks/1, otp_6711/1,
   38:          building/1, md5/1, encrypted_abstr/1, encrypted_abstr_file/1,
   39:          missing_debug_info_backend/1, literals/1
   40:         ]).
   41: -export([test_makedep_abstract_code/1]).
   42: 
   43: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   44: 
   45: suite() ->
   46:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   47:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   48: 
   49: all() -> 
   50:     [error, normal, cmp, cmp_literals, strip, strip_add_chunks, otp_6711,
   51:      building, md5, encrypted_abstr, encrypted_abstr_file,
   52:      missing_debug_info_backend, test_makedep_abstract_code,
   53:      literals
   54:     ].
   55: 
   56: groups() -> 
   57:     [].
   58: 
   59: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   60:     Config.
   61: 
   62: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   63:     %% Cleanup after strip and strip_add_chunks
   64:     case code:is_sticky(sofs) of
   65:         false ->
   66:             false = code:purge(sofs),
   67:             {module, sofs} = code:load_file(sofs),
   68:             code:stick_mod(sofs),
   69:             ok;
   70:         true ->
   71:             ok
   72:     end.
   73: 
   74: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   75:     Config.
   76: 
   77: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   78:     Config.
   79: 
   80: 
   81: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   82:     Config.
   83: 
   84: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   85:     ok.
   86: 
   87: %% Read correct beam file.
   88: normal(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
   89:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
   90:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
   91:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
   92:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
   93:     simple_file(Source),
   94: 
   95:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
   96:     P0 = pps(),
   97: 
   98:     do_normal(Source, PrivDir, BeamFile, []),
   99:     do_normal(Source, PrivDir, BeamFile, [r27]),
  100: 
  101:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,PrivDir}, no_debug_info]),
  102:     {ok, {simple, [{debug_info, {debug_info_v1, erl_abstract_code, {none, _}}}]}} =
  103: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [debug_info]),
  104:     {ok, {simple, [{abstract_code, no_abstract_code}]}} =
  105: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [abstract_code]),
  106: 
  107:     %% {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, [compressed | CompileFlags]),
  108:     %% do_normal(BeamFile),
  109: 
  110:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  111:     file:delete(Source),
  112:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  113:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  114:     ok.
  115: 
  116: do_normal(Source, PrivDir, BeamFile, Opts) ->
  117:     CompileFlags = [{outdir,PrivDir}, debug_info | Opts],
  118:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, CompileFlags),
  119:     {ok, Binary} = file:read_file(BeamFile),
  120: 
  121:     do_normal(BeamFile, Opts),
  122:     do_normal(Binary, Opts).
  123: 
  124: do_normal(BeamFile, _Opts) ->
  125:     Imports = {imports, [{erlang, get_module_info, 1},
  126: 			 {erlang, get_module_info, 2},
  127: 			 {lists, member, 2}]},
  128:     Exports = {exports, [{module_info, 0}, {module_info, 1}, {t, 0}]},
  129:     Local = {locals, [{t, 1}]},
  130:     {ok, {simple, [Imports]}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [imports]),
  131:     {ok, {simple, [{"ImpT",_Bin}]}} =
  132: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, ["ImpT"]),
  133:     {ok, {simple, [Exports]}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [exports]),
  134:     {ok, {simple, [{attributes, [{vsn, [_]}]}]}} =
  135: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [attributes]),
  136:     {ok, {simple, [{compile_info, _}=CompileInfo]}} =
  137: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [compile_info]),
  138:     {ok, {simple, [Local]}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [locals]),
  139:     {ok, {simple, [{attributes, [{vsn, [_]}]}, CompileInfo,
  140: 		   Exports, Imports, Local]}} =
  141: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [attributes, compile_info, exports, imports, locals]),
  142:     {ok, {simple, [{atoms, _Atoms}]}} =
  143: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [atoms]),
  144:     {ok, {simple, [{labeled_exports, _LExports}]}} =
  145: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [labeled_exports]),
  146:     {ok, {simple, [{labeled_locals, _LLocals}]}} =
  147: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [labeled_locals]),
  148:     {ok, {simple, [_Vsn]}} = beam_lib:version(BeamFile),
  149:     {ok, {simple, [{abstract_code, {_, _}}]}} =
  150: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [abstract_code]),
  151:     {ok, {simple, [{debug_info, {debug_info_v1, erl_abstract_code, _}}]}} =
  152: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [debug_info]),
  153: 
  154:     %% Test reading optional chunks.
  155:     All = ["Atom", "Code", "StrT", "ImpT", "ExpT", "FunT", "LitT", "AtU8"],
  156:     {ok,{simple,Chunks}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, All, [allow_missing_chunks]),
  157:     {missing_chunk, AtomBin} = verify_simple(Chunks),
  158:     true = is_binary(AtomBin),
  159: 
  160:     %% 'allow_missing_chunks' should work for named chunks too.
  161:     {ok, {simple, StrippedBeam}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFile),
  162:     {ok, {simple, MChunks}} = beam_lib:chunks(StrippedBeam,
  163:                                               [attributes, locals],
  164:                                               [allow_missing_chunks]),
  165:     [{attributes, missing_chunk}, {locals, missing_chunk}] = MChunks,
  166: 
  167:     %% Make sure that reading the atom chunk works when the 'allow_missing_chunks'
  168:     %% option is used.
  169:     Some = ["Code",atoms,"ExpT","LitT"],
  170:     {ok,{simple,SomeChunks}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, Some, [allow_missing_chunks]),
  171:     [{"Code",<<_/binary>>},{atoms,[_|_]},{"ExpT",<<_/binary>>},{"LitT",missing_chunk}] =
  172: 	SomeChunks.
  173: 
  174: verify_simple([{"Atom", PlainAtomChunk},
  175: 	       {"Code", CodeBin},
  176: 	       {"StrT", StrBin},
  177: 	       {"ImpT", ImpBin},
  178: 	       {"ExpT", ExpBin},
  179: 	       {"FunT", missing_chunk},
  180: 	       {"LitT", missing_chunk},
  181: 	       {"AtU8", AtU8Chunk}])
  182:   when is_binary(CodeBin), is_binary(StrBin),
  183:        is_binary(ImpBin), is_binary(ExpBin) ->
  184:     {PlainAtomChunk, AtU8Chunk}.
  185: 
  186: %% Read invalid beam files.
  187: error(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  188:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  189:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  190:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  191:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  192:     WrongFile = Simple ++ "foo.beam",
  193:     simple_file(Source),
  194: 
  195:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  196:     P0 = pps(),
  197:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,PrivDir},debug_info]),
  198:     ACopy = filename:join(PrivDir, "a_copy.beam"),
  199:     copy_file(BeamFile, ACopy),
  200: 
  201:     {ok, Binary} = file:read_file(BeamFile),
  202: 
  203:     copy_file(ACopy, WrongFile),
  204:     verify(file_error, beam_lib:info("./does_simply_not_exist")),
  205: 
  206:     do_error(BeamFile, ACopy),
  207:     do_error(Binary, ACopy),
  208: 
  209:     copy_file(ACopy, BeamFile),
  210:     verify(unknown_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [not_a_chunk])),
  211: 
  212:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, <<>>),
  213:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(BeamFile)),
  214:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(<<>>)),
  215:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, <<"short">>),
  216:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(BeamFile)),
  217:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(<<"short">>)),
  218: 
  219:     {Binary1, _} = split_binary(Binary, byte_size(Binary)-10),
  220:     LastChunk = last_chunk(Binary),
  221:     verify(chunk_too_big, beam_lib:chunks(Binary1, [LastChunk])),
  222:     Chunks = chunk_info(Binary),
  223:     {value, {_, DebugInfoStart, _}} = lists:keysearch("Dbgi", 1, Chunks),
  224:     {Binary2, _} = split_binary(Binary, DebugInfoStart),
  225:     verify(chunk_too_big, beam_lib:chunks(Binary2, ["Dbgi"])),
  226:     {Binary3, _} = split_binary(Binary, DebugInfoStart-4),
  227:     verify(invalid_beam_file, beam_lib:chunks(Binary3, ["Dbgi"])),
  228: 
  229:     %% Instead of the 5:32 field below, there used to be control characters
  230:     %% (including zero bytes) directly in the string. Because inferior programs
  231:     %% such as sed and clearcasediff don't like zero bytes in text files,
  232:     %% we have eliminated them.
  233:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, <<"FOR1",5:32,"BEAMfel">>),
  234: 
  235:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  236:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  237:     file:delete(Source),
  238:     file:delete(WrongFile),
  239:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  240:     file:delete(ACopy),
  241:     ok.
  242: 
  243: last_chunk(Bin) ->
  244:     L = beam_lib:info(Bin),
  245:     {chunks,Chunks} = lists:keyfind(chunks, 1, L),
  246:     {Last,_,_} = lists:last(Chunks),
  247:     Last.
  248: 
  249: do_error(BeamFile, ACopy) ->
  250:     %% evil tests
  251:     Chunks = chunk_info(BeamFile),
  252:     {value, {_, AtomStart, _}} = lists:keysearch("AtU8", 1, Chunks),
  253:     {value, {_, ImportStart, _}} = lists:keysearch("ImpT", 1, Chunks),
  254:     {value, {_, DebugInfoStart, _}} = lists:keysearch("Dbgi", 1, Chunks),
  255:     {value, {_, AttributesStart, _}} =
  256: 	lists:keysearch("Attr", 1, Chunks),
  257:     {value, {_, CompileInfoStart, _}} =
  258: 	lists:keysearch("CInf", 1, Chunks),
  259:     verify(missing_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, ["__"])),
  260:     BF2 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, ImportStart+4, 17),
  261:     verify(invalid_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF2, [imports])),
  262:     BF3 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, AtomStart-6, 17),
  263:     verify(missing_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF3, [imports])),
  264:     BF4 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, DebugInfoStart+10, 17),
  265:     verify(invalid_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF4, [debug_info])),
  266:     BF5 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, AttributesStart+8, 17),
  267:     verify(invalid_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF5, [attributes])),
  268: 
  269:     BF6 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, 1, 17),
  270:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(BF6)),
  271:     BF7 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, 9, 17),
  272:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(BF7)),
  273: 
  274:     BF8 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, 13, 17),
  275:     verify(missing_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF8, ["AtU8"])),
  276: 
  277:     BF9 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, CompileInfoStart+8, 17),
  278:     verify(invalid_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF9, [compile_info])).
  279: 
  280: 
  281: %% Compare contents of BEAM files and directories.
  282: cmp(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  283:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  284: 
  285:     Dir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir1"),
  286:     Dir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir2"),
  287: 
  288:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir1),
  289:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir2),
  290: 
  291:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(Dir1, simple, member),
  292:     {Source2D1, BeamFile2D1} = make_beam(Dir1, simple2, concat),
  293:     {SourceD2, BeamFileD2} = make_beam(Dir2, simple, concat),
  294: 
  295:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  296:     P0 = pps(),
  297: 
  298:     %% cmp
  299:     ok = beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD1),
  300:     ver(modules_different, beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFile2D1)),
  301:     ver(chunks_different, beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD2)),
  302:     verify(file_error, beam_lib:cmp(foo, bar)),
  303: 
  304:     {ok, B1} = file:read_file(BeamFileD1),
  305:     ok = beam_lib:cmp(B1, BeamFileD1),
  306:     {ok, B2} = file:read_file(BeamFileD2),
  307:     ver(chunks_different, beam_lib:cmp(B1, B2)),
  308: 
  309:     %% cmp_dirs
  310:     {[],[],[]} = beam_lib:cmp_dirs(Dir1, Dir1),
  311:     true = {[BeamFile2D1], [], [{BeamFileD1,BeamFileD2}]} ==
  312: 	beam_lib:cmp_dirs(Dir1, Dir2),
  313:     true = {[], [BeamFile2D1], [{BeamFileD2,BeamFileD1}]} ==
  314: 	beam_lib:cmp_dirs(Dir2, Dir1),
  315:     ver(not_a_directory, beam_lib:cmp_dirs(foo, bar)),
  316: 
  317:     %% diff_dirs
  318:     ok = beam_lib:diff_dirs(Dir1, Dir1),
  319:     ver(not_a_directory, beam_lib:diff_dirs(foo, bar)),
  320: 
  321:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  322:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  323:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1, Source2D1,
  324: 		  BeamFile2D1, SourceD2, BeamFileD2]),
  325: 
  326:     file:del_dir(Dir1),
  327:     file:del_dir(Dir2),
  328:     ok.
  329: 
  330: %% Compare contents of BEAM files having literals.
  331: cmp_literals(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  332:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  333: 
  334:     Dir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir1"),
  335:     Dir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir2"),
  336: 
  337:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir1),
  338:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir2),
  339: 
  340:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(Dir1, simple, constant),
  341:     {SourceD2, BeamFileD2} = make_beam(Dir2, simple, constant2),
  342: 
  343:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  344:     P0 = pps(),
  345: 
  346:     %% cmp
  347:     ok = beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD1),
  348:     ver(chunks_different, beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD2)),
  349: 
  350:     {ok, B1} = file:read_file(BeamFileD1),
  351:     ok = beam_lib:cmp(B1, BeamFileD1),
  352:     {ok, B2} = file:read_file(BeamFileD2),
  353:     ver(chunks_different, beam_lib:cmp(B1, B2)),
  354: 
  355:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  356:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  357: 
  358:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1, SourceD2, BeamFileD2]),
  359: 
  360:     file:del_dir(Dir1),
  361:     file:del_dir(Dir2),
  362:     ok.
  363: 
  364: %% Strip BEAM files.
  365: strip(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  366:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  367:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(PrivDir, simple, member),
  368:     {Source2D1, BeamFile2D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, simple2, concat),
  369:     {Source3D1, BeamFile3D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, make_fun, make_fun),
  370:     {Source4D1, BeamFile4D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, constant, constant),
  371:     {Source5D1, BeamFile5D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, lines, lines),
  372: 
  373:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  374:     P0 = pps(),
  375: 
  376:     %% strip binary
  377:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:strip(<<>>)),
  378:     {ok, B1} = file:read_file(BeamFileD1),
  379:     {ok, {simple, NB1}} = beam_lib:strip(B1),
  380:     BId1 = chunk_ids(B1),
  381:     NBId1 = chunk_ids(NB1),
  382:     true = length(BId1) > length(NBId1),
  383:     compare_chunks(B1, NB1, NBId1),
  384: 
  385:     %% strip file
  386:     verify(file_error, beam_lib:strip(foo)),
  387:     {ok, {simple, _}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFileD1),
  388:     compare_chunks(NB1, BeamFileD1, NBId1),
  389: 
  390:     %% strip_files
  391:     {ok, B2} = file:read_file(BeamFile2D1),
  392:     {ok, [{simple,_},{simple2,_}]} = beam_lib:strip_files([B1, B2]),
  393:     {ok, [{simple,_},{simple2,_},{make_fun,_},{constant,_}]} =
  394: 	beam_lib:strip_files([BeamFileD1, BeamFile2D1, BeamFile3D1, BeamFile4D1]),
  395: 
  396:     %% strip a complex module
  397:     OrigSofsPath = code:where_is_file("sofs.beam"),
  398:     BeamFileSofs = filename:join(PrivDir,"sofs.beam"),
  399:     file:copy(OrigSofsPath, BeamFileSofs),
  400:     {ok, {sofs,_}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFileSofs),
  401:     code:unstick_mod(sofs),
  402:     false = code:purge(sofs),
  403: 
  404:     %% check that each module can be loaded.
  405:     {module, simple} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFileD1)),
  406:     {module, simple2} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile2D1)),
  407:     {module, make_fun} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile3D1)),
  408:     {module, constant} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile4D1)),
  409:     {module, sofs} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFileSofs)),
  410: 
  411:     %% check that line number information is still present after stripping
  412:     {module, lines} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile5D1)),
  413:     Info = get_line_number_info(),
  414:     true = code:delete(lines),
  415:     false = code:purge(lines),
  416:     {ok, {lines,BeamFile5D1}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFile5D1),
  417:     {module, lines} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile5D1)),
  418:     Info = get_line_number_info(),
  419: 
  420:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  421:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  422: 
  423:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1,
  424: 		  Source2D1, BeamFile2D1,
  425: 		  Source3D1, BeamFile3D1,
  426: 		  Source4D1, BeamFile4D1,
  427: 		  Source5D1, BeamFile5D1,
  428:                   BeamFileSofs]),
  429: 
  430:     false = code:purge(sofs),
  431:     {module, sofs} = code:load_file(sofs),
  432:     code:stick_mod(sofs),
  433:     ok.
  434: 
  435: strip_add_chunks(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  436:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  437:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(PrivDir, simple, member),
  438:     {Source2D1, BeamFile2D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, simple2, concat),
  439:     {Source3D1, BeamFile3D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, make_fun, make_fun),
  440:     {Source4D1, BeamFile4D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, constant, constant),
  441:     {Source5D1, BeamFile5D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, lines, lines),
  442: 
  443:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  444:     P0 = pps(),
  445: 
  446:     %% strip binary
  447:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:strip(<<>>)),
  448:     {ok, B1} = file:read_file(BeamFileD1),
  449:     {ok, {simple, NB1}} = beam_lib:strip(B1),
  450: 
  451:     BId1 = chunk_ids(B1),
  452:     NBId1 = chunk_ids(NB1),
  453:     true = length(BId1) > length(NBId1),
  454:     compare_chunks(B1, NB1, NBId1),
  455: 
  456:     %% Keep all the extra chunks
  457:     ExtraChunks = ["Abst", "Dbgi", "Attr", "CInf", "Docs", "LocT", "Atom"],
  458:     {ok, {simple, AB1}} = beam_lib:strip(B1, ExtraChunks),
  459:     ABId1 = chunk_ids(AB1),
  460:     true = length(BId1) == length(ABId1),
  461:     compare_chunks(B1, AB1, ABId1),
  462: 
  463:     %% strip file - Keep extra chunks
  464:     verify(file_error, beam_lib:strip(foo)),
  465:     {ok, {simple, _}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFileD1, ExtraChunks),
  466:     compare_chunks(B1, BeamFileD1, ABId1),
  467: 
  468:     %% strip_files
  469:     {ok, B2} = file:read_file(BeamFile2D1),
  470:     {ok, [{simple,_},{simple2,_}]} = beam_lib:strip_files([B1, B2], ExtraChunks),
  471:     {ok, [{simple,_},{simple2,_},{make_fun,_},{constant,_}]} =
  472: 	beam_lib:strip_files([BeamFileD1, BeamFile2D1, BeamFile3D1, BeamFile4D1], ExtraChunks),
  473: 
  474:     %% strip a complex module
  475:     OrigSofsPath = code:where_is_file("sofs.beam"),
  476:     BeamFileSofs = filename:join(PrivDir,"sofs.beam"),
  477:     file:copy(OrigSofsPath, BeamFileSofs),
  478:     {ok, {sofs,_}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFileSofs, ExtraChunks),
  479:     code:unstick_mod(sofs),
  480:     false = code:purge(sofs),
  481: 
  482:     %% check that each module can be loaded.
  483:     {module, simple} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFileD1)),
  484:     {module, simple2} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile2D1)),
  485:     {module, make_fun} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile3D1)),
  486:     {module, constant} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile4D1)),
  487:     {module, sofs} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFileSofs)),
  488: 
  489:     %% check that line number information is still present after stripping
  490:     {module, lines} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile5D1)),
  491:     Info = get_line_number_info(),
  492:     false = code:purge(lines),
  493:     true = code:delete(lines),
  494:     {ok, {lines,BeamFile5D1}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFile5D1),
  495:     {module, lines} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile5D1)),
  496:     Info = get_line_number_info(),
  497: 
  498:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  499:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  500: 
  501:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1,
  502: 		  Source2D1, BeamFile2D1,
  503: 		  Source3D1, BeamFile3D1,
  504: 		  Source4D1, BeamFile4D1,
  505: 		  Source5D1, BeamFile5D1,
  506:                   BeamFileSofs]),
  507: 
  508:     false = code:purge(sofs),
  509:     {module, sofs} = code:load_file(sofs),
  510:     code:stick_mod(sofs),
  511: 
  512:     ok.
  513: 
  514: otp_6711(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  515:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:info(3)}),
  516:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:chunks(a, b)}),
  517:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:chunks(a,b,c)}),
  518:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:all_chunks(3)}),
  519:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:cmp(3,4)}),
  520:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:strip(3)}),
  521:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} =
  522:         (catch {a, beam_lib:strip_files([3])}),
  523: 
  524:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  525:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir"),
  526:     Lib = filename:join(Dir, "lib"),
  527:     App = filename:join(Lib, "app"),
  528:     EBin = filename:join(App, "ebin"),
  529: 
  530:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  531:     ok = file:make_dir(Lib),
  532:     ok = file:make_dir(App),
  533:     ok = file:make_dir(EBin),
  534: 
  535:     {SourceD, BeamFileD} = make_beam(EBin, simple, member),
  536: 
  537:     unwritable(BeamFileD),
  538: 
  539:     %% There is no way that strip_release can fail with
  540:     %% function_clause or something like that...
  541:     {error,_,{file_error,_,_}} = beam_lib:strip_release(Dir),
  542: 
  543:     delete_files([SourceD, BeamFileD]),
  544:     file:del_dir(EBin),
  545:     file:del_dir(App),
  546:     file:del_dir(Lib),
  547:     file:del_dir(Dir),
  548:     ok.
  549: 
  550: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
  551: 
  552: unwritable(Fname) ->
  553:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Fname),
  554:     Mode = Info#file_info.mode - 8#00200,
  555:     file:write_file_info(Fname, Info#file_info{mode = Mode}).
  556: 
  557: %% Testing building of BEAM files.
  558: building(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  559:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  560: 
  561:     Dir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "b_dir1"),
  562:     Dir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "b_dir2"),
  563: 
  564:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir1),
  565:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir2),
  566: 
  567:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(Dir1, building, member),
  568: 
  569:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  570:     P0 = pps(),
  571: 
  572:     %% read all chunks
  573:     ChunkIds = chunk_ids(BeamFileD1),
  574:     {ok, _Mod, Chunks} = beam_lib:all_chunks(BeamFileD1),
  575:     ChunkIds = lists:map(fun ({Id, Data}) when is_binary(Data) -> Id
  576: 			 end, Chunks),
  577: 
  578:     %% write a new beam file, with reversed chunk order
  579:     BeamFileD2 = filename:join(Dir2, "building.beam"),
  580:     {ok,RevBeam} = beam_lib:build_module(lists:reverse(Chunks)),
  581:     file:write_file(BeamFileD2, RevBeam),
  582: 
  583:     %% compare files
  584:     compare_chunks(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD2, ChunkIds),
  585: 
  586:     %% test that we can retrieve a chunk before the atom table
  587:     %% (actually, try to retrieve all chunks)
  588: 
  589:     lists:foreach(fun(Id) ->
  590: 			  {ok, {building, [{Id, _Data}]}} =
  591: 			      beam_lib:chunks(BeamFileD1, [Id])
  592: 		  end, ChunkIds),
  593:     lists:foreach(fun(Id) ->
  594: 			  {ok, {building, [{Id, _Data}]}} =
  595: 			      beam_lib:chunks(BeamFileD2, [Id])
  596: 		  end, ChunkIds),
  597: 
  598:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  599:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  600: 
  601:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1, BeamFileD2]),
  602:     file:del_dir(Dir1),
  603:     file:del_dir(Dir2),
  604:     ok.
  605: 
  606: %% Compare beam_lib:md5/1 and code:module_md5/1.
  607: md5(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  608:     Beams = collect_beams(),
  609:     io:format("Found ~w beam files", [length(Beams)]),
  610:     md5_1(Beams).
  611: 
  612: md5_1([N|Ns]) ->
  613:     {ok,Beam0} = file:read_file(N),
  614:     Beam = maybe_uncompress(Beam0),
  615:     {ok,{Mod,MD5}} = beam_lib:md5(Beam),
  616:     {Mod,MD5} = {Mod,code:module_md5(Beam)},
  617:     md5_1(Ns);
  618: md5_1([]) -> ok.
  619: 
  620: collect_beams() ->
  621:     SuperDir = filename:dirname(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))),
  622:     TestDirs = filelib:wildcard(filename:join([SuperDir,"*_test"])),
  623:     AbsDirs = [filename:absname(X) || X <- code:get_path()],
  624:     collect_beams_1(AbsDirs ++ TestDirs).
  625: 
  626: collect_beams_1([Dir|Dirs]) ->
  627:     filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*.beam")) ++ collect_beams_1(Dirs);
  628: collect_beams_1([]) -> [].
  629: 
  630: maybe_uncompress(<<"FOR1",_/binary>>=Beam) -> Beam;
  631: maybe_uncompress(Beam) -> zlib:gunzip(Beam).
  632: 
  633: %% Test encrypted abstract format.
  634: encrypted_abstr(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  635:     run_if_crypto_works(fun() -> encrypted_abstr_1(Conf) end).
  636: 
  637: encrypted_abstr_1(Conf) ->
  638:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  639:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  640:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  641:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  642:     simple_file(Source),
  643: 
  644:     %% Avoid getting an extra port when crypto starts erl_ddll.
  645:     erl_ddll:start(),
  646: 
  647:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  648:     P0 = pps(),
  649: 
  650:     Key = "#a_crypto_key",
  651:     CompileFlags = [{outdir,PrivDir}, debug_info, {debug_info_key,Key}],
  652:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, CompileFlags),
  653:     {ok, Binary} = file:read_file(BeamFile),
  654: 
  655:     do_encrypted_abstr(BeamFile, Key),
  656:     do_encrypted_abstr(Binary, Key),
  657: 
  658:     ok = application:stop(crypto),			%To get rid of extra ets tables.
  659:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  660:     file:delete(Source),
  661:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  662:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  663:     ok.
  664: 
  665: do_encrypted_abstr(Beam, Key) ->
  666:     verify(key_missing_or_invalid, beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [debug_info])),
  667: 
  668:     %% The raw chunk "Dbgi" can still be read even without a key.
  669:     {ok,{simple,[{"Dbgi",Dbgi}]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["Dbgi"]),
  670:     <<0:8,8:8,"des3_cbc",_/binary>> = Dbgi,
  671: 
  672:     %% Try som invalid funs.
  673:     bad_fun(badfun, fun() -> ok end),
  674:     bad_fun(badfun, {a,b}),
  675:     bad_fun(blurf),
  676:     {function_clause,_} = bad_fun(fun(glurf) -> ok end),
  677: 
  678:     %% Funs that return something strange.
  679:     bad_fun(badfun, fun(init) -> {ok,fun() -> ok end} end),
  680:     glurf = bad_fun(fun(init) -> {error,glurf} end),
  681: 
  682:     %% Try clearing (non-existing fun).
  683:     undefined = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  684: 
  685:     %% Install a fun which cannot retrieve a key.
  686:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(fun(init) -> ok end),
  687:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  688: 
  689:     %% Install a fun which returns an incorrect key.
  690:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  691:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(simple_crypto_fun("wrong key...")),
  692:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  693: 
  694:     %% Installing a new key fun is not possible without clearing the old.
  695:     verify(exists, beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(simple_crypto_fun(Key))),
  696: 
  697:     %% Install the simplest possible working key fun.
  698:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  699:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(simple_crypto_fun(Key)),
  700:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  701:     {ok,{simple,[{"Dbgi",Dbgi}]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["Dbgi"]),
  702: 
  703:     %% Installing a new key fun is not possible without clearing the old.
  704:     verify(exists, beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(ets_crypto_fun(Key))),
  705: 
  706:     %% Install a key using an ets table.
  707:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  708:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(ets_crypto_fun(Key)),
  709:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  710:     {ok,{simple,[{"Dbgi",Dbgi}]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["Dbgi"]),
  711: 
  712:     {ok,cleared} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  713: 
  714:     %% Try to force a stop/start race.
  715:     start_stop_race(10000),
  716: 
  717:     ok.
  718: 
  719: start_stop_race(0) ->
  720:     ok;
  721: start_stop_race(N) ->
  722:     {error,_} = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(bad_fun),
  723:     undefined = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  724:     start_stop_race(N-1).
  725: 
  726: bad_fun(F) ->
  727:     {error,E} = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(F),
  728:     E.
  729: 
  730: bad_fun(S, F) ->
  731:     verify(S, beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(F)).
  732: 
  733: verify_abstract(Beam) ->
  734:     {ok,{simple,[Abst, Dbgi]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code, debug_info]),
  735:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Abst,
  736:     {debug_info,{debug_info_v1,erl_abstract_code,_}} = Dbgi.
  737: 
  738: simple_crypto_fun(Key) ->
  739:     fun(init) -> ok;
  740:        ({debug_info, des3_cbc, simple, _}) -> Key
  741:     end.
  742: 
  743: ets_crypto_fun(Key) ->
  744:     fun(init) ->
  745: 	    T = ets:new(beam_lib_SUITE_keys, [private, set]),
  746: 	    true = ets:insert(T, {key,Key}),
  747: 	    {ok,fun({debug_info, des3_cbc, simple, _}) ->
  748: 			[{key,Val}] = ets:lookup(T, key),
  749: 			Val;
  750: 		   (clear) ->
  751: 			ets:delete(T),
  752: 			cleared
  753: 		end}
  754:     end.
  755: 
  756: %% Test encrypted abstract format with the key in .erlang.crypt.
  757: encrypted_abstr_file(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  758:     run_if_crypto_works(fun() -> encrypted_abstr_file_1(Conf) end).
  759: 
  760: encrypted_abstr_file_1(Conf) ->
  761:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  762:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  763:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  764:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  765:     simple_file(Source),
  766: 
  767:     %% Avoid getting an extra port when crypto starts erl_ddll.
  768:     erl_ddll:start(),
  769: 
  770:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  771:     P0 = pps(),
  772: 
  773:     Key = "Long And niCe 99Krypto Key",
  774:     CompileFlags = [{outdir,PrivDir}, debug_info, {debug_info_key,Key}],
  775:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, CompileFlags),
  776:     {ok, Binary} = file:read_file(BeamFile),
  777: 
  778:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  779:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  780:     do_encrypted_abstr_file(BeamFile, Key),
  781:     do_encrypted_abstr_file(Binary, Key),
  782:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldCwd),
  783: 
  784:     ok = application:stop(crypto),			%To get rid of extra ets tables.
  785:     file:delete(filename:join(PrivDir, ".erlang.crypt")),
  786:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  787:     file:delete(Source),
  788:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  789:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  790:     ok.
  791: 
  792: do_encrypted_abstr_file(Beam, Key) ->
  793:     %% No key.
  794:     write_crypt_file(""),
  795:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  796: 
  797:     %% A wrong key.
  798:     write_crypt_file(["[{debug_info,des3_cbc,simple,\"A Wrong Key\"}].\n"]),
  799:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  800: 
  801:     %% Write correct key...
  802:     write_crypt_file(["[{debug_info,des3_cbc,simple,\"",Key,"\"}].\n"]),
  803: 
  804:     %% ... but the fun with the wrong key is still there.
  805:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  806: 
  807:     %% Clear the fun. Now it should work.
  808:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  809:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  810:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  811:     ok = file:delete(".erlang.crypt"),
  812:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  813: 
  814:     %% Clear, otherwise the second pass will fail.
  815:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  816:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  817:     ok.
  818: 
  819: test_makedep_abstract_code(Conf) ->
  820:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  821:     ErlFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "hello.erl"),
  822:     BeamFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "hello.beam"),
  823:     file:write_file(ErlFile,
  824: 		    ["-module(hello).\n",
  825: 		     "-export([start/0]).\n",
  826: 		     "start() -> ok.\n"
  827: 		    ]),
  828:     DependDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "depend"),
  829:     file:make_dir(DependDir),
  830:     DependFile = filename:join(DependDir,"hello.d"),
  831:     compile:file(ErlFile,
  832: 		 [debug_info,
  833: 		  makedep_side_effect,
  834: 		  {outdir, PrivDir},
  835: 		  {makedep_output, DependFile}]),
  836:     file:delete(DependFile),
  837:     file:del_dir(DependDir),
  838:     case beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [debug_info]) of
  839: 	{ok, {Module, [{debug_info, {debug_info_v1,
  840: 				     _Backend=erl_abstract_code,Metadata}}]}} ->
  841: 	    SrcOpts = [no_copt, to_core, binary, return_errors,
  842: 		       no_inline, strict_record_tests, strict_record_updates,
  843: 		       dialyzer, no_spawn_compiler_process],
  844: 	    {ok,_} = erl_abstract_code:debug_info(core_v1, Module, Metadata,
  845: 						  SrcOpts),
  846:             ok
  847:     end.
  848:     
  849: 
  850: write_crypt_file(Contents0) ->
  851:     Contents = list_to_binary([Contents0]),
  852:     io:format("~s\n", [binary_to_list(Contents)]),
  853:     ok = file:write_file(".erlang.crypt", Contents).
  854: 
  855: %% GH-4353: Don't crash when the backend for generating the abstract code
  856: %% is missing.
  857: missing_debug_info_backend(Conf) ->
  858:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  859:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  860:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  861:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  862:     simple_file(Source),
  863: 
  864:     %% Create a debug_info chunk with a non-existing backend.
  865:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,PrivDir}]),
  866:     {ok,simple,All0} = beam_lib:all_chunks(BeamFile),
  867:     FakeBackend = definitely__not__an__existing__backend,
  868:     FakeDebugInfo = {debug_info_v1, FakeBackend, nothing_here},
  869:     All = lists:keyreplace("Dbgi", 1, All0, {"Dbgi", term_to_binary(FakeDebugInfo)}),
  870:     {ok,NewBeam} = beam_lib:build_module(All),
  871:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, NewBeam),
  872: 
  873:     %% beam_lib should not crash, but return an error.
  874:     verify(missing_backend, beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [abstract_code])),
  875:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  876: 
  877:     ok.
  878: 
  879: literals(Conf) ->
  880:     do_literals(Conf, []),
  881:     do_literals(Conf, [r27]),
  882: 
  883:     ok.
  884: 
  885: do_literals(Conf, Options) ->
  886:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  887:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  888:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  889:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  890:     simple_file(Source, simple, literals),
  891: 
  892:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,PrivDir},report|Options]),
  893: 
  894:     {ok, {simple, [{literals,[{0,{literal,tuple}}]}]}} =
  895: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [literals]),
  896: 
  897:     ok = file:delete(Source),
  898:     ok = file:delete(BeamFile),
  899: 
  900:     ok.
  901: 
  902: compare_chunks(File1, File2, ChunkIds) ->
  903:     {ok, {_, Chunks1}} = beam_lib:chunks(File1, ChunkIds),
  904:     {ok, {_, Chunks2}} = beam_lib:chunks(File2, ChunkIds),
  905:     true = Chunks1 == Chunks2.
  906: 
  907: chunk_ids(File) ->
  908:     lists:map(fun({Id,_Start,_Size}) -> Id end, chunk_info(File)).
  909: 
  910: chunk_info(File) ->
  911:     {value, {chunks, Chunks}} =
  912: 	lists:keysearch(chunks, 1, beam_lib:info(File)),
  913:     Chunks.
  914: 
  915: make_beam(Dir, Module, F) ->
  916:     FileBase = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Module)),
  917:     Source = FileBase ++ ".erl",
  918:     BeamFile = FileBase ++ ".beam",
  919:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  920:     simple_file(Source, Module, F),
  921:     {ok, _} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,Dir}, debug_info, report]),
  922:     {Source, BeamFile}.
  923: 
  924: set_byte(_Backup, Binary, Pos, Byte) when is_binary(Binary) ->
  925:     <<B1:Pos/binary, _:1/binary, B2/binary>> = Binary,
  926:     NB = <<B1/binary, Byte:8, B2/binary>>,
  927:     NB;
  928: set_byte(Backup, File, Pos, Byte) ->
  929:     copy_file(Backup, File),
  930:     set_byte(File, Pos, Byte),
  931:     File.
  932: 
  933: set_byte(File, Pos, Byte) ->
  934:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read, write]),
  935:     {ok, _} = file:position(Fd, Pos),
  936:     ok = file:write(Fd, [Byte]),
  937:     file:close(Fd).
  938: 
  939: copy_file(Src, Dest) ->
  940:     {ok, _} = file:copy(Src, Dest),
  941:     ok = file:change_mode(Dest, 8#0666).
  942: 
  943: delete_files(Files) ->
  944:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> file:delete(F) end, Files).
  945: 
  946: verify(S, {error, beam_lib, R}) ->
  947:     verify_error(S, R);
  948: verify(S, {error, R}) ->
  949:     verify_error(S, R).
  950: 
  951: verify_error(S, R) ->
  952:     if
  953: 	S =:= R -> ok;
  954: 	true -> [S|_] = tuple_to_list(R)
  955:     end,
  956: 
  957:     %% Most formatted messages begin with "./simple.beam:" or "<<...".
  958:     FM = string:str(lists:flatten(beam_lib:format_error(R)), "simpl") > 0,
  959:     BM = string:str(lists:flatten(beam_lib:format_error(R)), "<<") > 0,
  960: 
  961:     %% Also make sure that formatted message is not just the term printed.
  962:     Handled = beam_lib:format_error(R) =/= io_lib:format("~p~n", [R]),
  963:     true = (FM > 0 orelse BM > 0) andalso Handled.
  964: 
  965: ver(S, {error, beam_lib, R}) ->
  966:     [S|_] = tuple_to_list(R),
  967:     case lists:flatten(beam_lib:format_error(R)) of
  968: 	[${ | _] ->
  969: 	    ct:fail({bad_format_error, R});
  970: 	_ ->
  971: 	    ok
  972:     end.
  973: 
  974: pps() ->
  975:     {erlang:ports()}.
  976: 
  977: simple_file(File) ->
  978:     simple_file(File, simple).
  979: 
  980: simple_file(File, Module) ->
  981:     simple_file(File, Module, member).
  982: 
  983: simple_file(File, Module, make_fun) ->
  984:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
  985: 			"-export([t/1]). "
  986: 			"t(A) -> "
  987: 			"    fun(X) -> A+X end. "]),
  988:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
  989: simple_file(File, Module, constant) ->
  990:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
  991: 			"-export([t/1]). "
  992: 			"t(A) -> "
  993: 			"    {a,b,[2,3],c,d}. "]),
  994:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
  995: simple_file(File, Module, constant2) ->
  996:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
  997: 			"-export([t/1]). "
  998: 			"t(A) -> "
  999: 			"    {a,b,[2,3],x,y}. "]),
 1000:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
 1001: simple_file(File, Module, lines) ->
 1002:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), ").\n"
 1003: 			"-export([t/1]).\n"
 1004: 			"t(A) ->\n"
 1005: 			"    A+1.\n"]),
 1006:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
 1007: simple_file(File, Module, literals) ->
 1008:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
 1009: 			"-export([t/0]). "
 1010: 			"t() -> "
 1011: 			"    {literal, tuple}. "]),
 1012:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
 1013: simple_file(File, Module, F) ->
 1014:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
 1015: 			"-export([t/0]). "
 1016: 			"t() -> "
 1017: 			"    t([]). "
 1018: 			"t(L) -> "
 1019: 			"    lists:", 
 1020: 			atom_to_list(F), "(a, L). "]),
 1021:     ok = file:write_file(File, B).
 1022: 
 1023: run_if_crypto_works(Test) ->
 1024:     try	begin application:start(crypto), application:stop(crypto), ok end of
 1025: 	ok ->
 1026: 	    Test()
 1027:     catch
 1028: 	error:_ ->
 1029: 	    {skip,"The crypto application is missing or broken"}
 1030:     end.
 1031: 
 1032: get_line_number_info() ->
 1033:     %% The stacktrace for operators such a '+' can vary depending on
 1034:     %% whether the JIT is used or not.
 1035:     case catch lines:t(atom) of
 1036:         {'EXIT',{badarith,[{erlang,'+',[atom,1],_},
 1037:                            {lines,t,1,Info}|_]}} ->
 1038:             Info;
 1039:         {'EXIT',{badarith,[{lines,t,1,Info}|_]}} ->
 1040:             Info
 1041:     end.
